===Etymology===
Borrowed from an Iranian language in Central Asia during the {{w|Han Dynasty}}, probably {{etyl|kho|zh}} {{m|kho|sam̥gga-||stone}}. Compare Modern {{cog|fa|سنگ|tr=sang||stone}}.

# [[coral]]

==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|サンゴ}}
{{wikipedia|Coral}}
[[Image:Coral_Outcrop_Flynn_Reef.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|珊瑚}} (''sango''): a piece of '''coral'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|さん|ご|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=さんご}} {{m|zh|珊瑚}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|さんご|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|さんご|サンゴ}}

# [[coral]]

====Usage notes====
As with many biology terms, this term is often written in [[katakana]], as {{l|ja|サンゴ}}. However, due to the large number of [[homophone]]s in Japanese, dictionaries will often list such terms under the [[kanji]] spelling for [[disambiguation]] purposes.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|珊瑚アナナス|さんご アナナス}}: the [[coralberry]] plant, {{taxlink|Aechmea fulgens|species|noshow=1|ver=161023}}
* {{ja-r|珊瑚海|^さんご ^かい}}: the [[Coral Sea]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚蟹|さんごがに}}: the {{vern|coral crab}}, family ''{{taxlink|Xanthidae|family|noshow=1|ver=161023}}''
* {{ja-r|珊瑚砂|さんごしゃ}}: coral [[sand]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚珠|さんごじゅ}}: coral beads
* {{ja-r|珊瑚樹|さんごじゅ}}: a coral [[formation]]; {{taxlink|Viburnum odoratissimum|species|noshow=1|ver=161023}}
* {{ja-r|珊瑚樹茄子|さんごじゅ なす}}: alternate for name {{ja-r|トマト}}
* {{ja-r|珊瑚礁|さんごしょう}}: a coral [[reef]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚藻|さんごも}}: a type of [[seaweed]], {{vern|coralline algae}} ([[Corallinales]])
* {{ja-r|珊瑚虫|さんごちゅう}}: a coral [[polyp]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚島|さんごとう}}: a coral [[island]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚末|さんごまつ}}: coral [[powder]], used as a [[pigment]]
* {{ja-r|珊瑚網|さんご あみ}}: a [[net]] used to gather coral
{{der-bottom}}
